did.abstract: Business letters of the mercantile firm of E. and J. Harding and of its branch firms at Danville, Pleasant Grove (Lunenburg County), and Moore's Ordinary, all in Virginia. Included are invoices for liquor, a few dealers' circulars, and one letter of a Confederate soldier, dated January 17, 1865, mentioning scarcity of food, low morale among the soldiers, and their hope for the immediate fall of Fort Fisher and the end of the war.
